title: Linear and rotation - rolling without friction

content.question: A disk of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> moves with negligible friction along a horizontal surface with a translational velocity <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> as it rotates with an angular velocity <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math>. Which of the following statements must be true regarding the angular velocity of the disk?

choices.label: <math alttext="omega equals the fraction v over R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>v</mi><mi>R</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="omega is less than the fraction v over R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mi>v</mi><mi>R</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="omega is greater than the fraction v over R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mo>></mo><mfrac><mi>v</mi><mi>R</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

A relationship cannot be determined for <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> in terms of <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>.

content.answer: A relationship cannot be determined for <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> in terms of <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>.
